item.title: 咖啡热潮席卷商店，拿铁咖啡将更贵
item.description: 最近贸易战充满不确定性，您可能需要额外的咖啡因来度过新闻密集的日子。但您可能也想知道，咖啡价格的大幅上涨会在多大程度上影响到咖啡馆和超市。【原文：With all the trade-war uncertainty lately, you may need an extra caffeine fix to get though news-heavy days. But you also might be wondering to what extent a big rally in coffee prices will filter through to cafes and supermarkets.】

item.title: 休斯顿会议在大天然气氛围中落下帷幕
item.description:
代表们一致认为，人工智能时代对发电厂燃料的需求将急剧上升。【原文：

Delegates agree that the AI era will see demand for the power-plant fuel balloon.

】

item.title: 霍尔茨曼告诉普拉托，大幅财政刺激可能迫使欧洲央行加息
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员罗伯特-霍尔茨曼（Robert Holzmann）告诉德国《普拉托简报》，政府支出增加可能迫使欧洲央行再次开始加息。【原文：Higher government spending could force the European Central Bank to start raising interest rates again, Governing Council member Robert Holzmann told Germany’s Platow Brief.】

item.title: 通胀飙升，预期利率上升而非下降的英国人增多
item.description: 尽管英国央行承诺继续逐步放宽政策，但英国家庭预计利率将因通胀回升而上调。【原文：UK households expect interest rates to rise in response to a resurgence in inflation, despite the Bank of England pledging to continue gradually easing policy.】

item.title: 据称自由通信将与沃达丰洽谈荷兰合资公司股权事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Liberty Global Ltd. 已与沃达丰集团（Vodafone Group Plc）接洽，希望收购其在荷兰合资企业 VodafoneZiggo 中的股份。【原文：Liberty Global Ltd. has approached Vodafone Group Plc for a potential acquisition of its stake in their Dutch joint venture VodafoneZiggo, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 债务谈判进入最后阶段，德国债券跌势再起
item.description: 周五，在有报道称德国各政党达成协议，将为国防和基础设施建设释放数千亿欧元资金后，德国债券的抛售势头有所增强。【原文：The selloff in Germany’s bonds gained traction on Friday after reports of an agreement between political parties that’s set to unlock hundreds of billions of euros for defense and infrastructure.】

item.title: 暴力崇拜源于硅谷对人工智能安全的追求
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们改版后的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，埃伦-休特（Ellen Huet）撰文报道了围绕一个小型暴力团体和硅谷社区的交叉电流，硅谷社区致力于控制可能失控的人工智能。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our revamped daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ellen Huet writes about the crosscurrents surrounding a small, violent group and the Silicon Valley communities devoted to reining in potentially out-of-control artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 阿布扎比的 Adnoc 据称酝酿收购穆巴达拉能源资产
item.description: 据知情人士透露，阿布扎比国家石油公司正在权衡收购主权财富基金穆巴达拉投资公司（Mubadala Investment Co.【原文：Abu Dhabi’s state oil firm is weighing plans to buy the energy assets of sovereign wealth fund Mubadala Investment Co., according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 德国商报》称，默茨与绿党就德国债务问题达成协议
item.description: 据《商报》报道，德国候任总理弗里德里希-梅尔茨（Friedrich Merz）与绿党就一项财政改革方案达成协议，将对基础设施和国防进行大规模投资。【原文：Germany’s chancellor-in-waiting Friedrich Merz reached an agreement with the Greens party on a fiscal reform package for large investments on infrastructure and defense, according to a report by newspaper Handelsblatt.】

item.title: 五年过去了，Covid-19 大流行病对世界经济的影响依然存在
item.description: 我是驻香港的亚洲经济记者 Katia Dmitrieva。今天我们来看看大流行后五年的世界。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net，或通过 @economics 在 X 上与我们联系。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Katia Dmitrieva, Asia economics correspondent in Hong Kong. Today we’re looking at the world five years post-pandemic. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net or get in touch on X via @economics. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 钢铁买家进入关税时代，船舶改道，卡车停运
item.description: 周二，一艘来自印度的远洋货轮驶入繁华的坦帕湾港，船上装载着数百吨铝，目的地是美国的多个港口。突然，整批货物被命令当场卸载。【原文：An ocean freighter from India pulled into the bustling Port of Tampa Bay Tuesday loaded with hundreds of tons of aluminum destined for multiple US stops. Abruptly, the entire shipment was ordered to be unloaded then and there.】

item.title: 美联储预计今年将降息两次，从九月开始
item.description: 据彭博新闻社调查的经济学家称，美联储将在今年上半年保持利率稳定，然后从 9 月份开始两次降息。【原文：The Federal Reserve will keep interest rates steady through the first half of the year, before delivering two reductions beginning in September, according to economists surveyed by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 法国债券收益率在惠誉调查前升至 2011 年以来最高点
item.description: 法国的长期借款成本攀升至 2011 年以来的最高水平，因为人们担心法国可能会有史以来第一次被降级为单 A 级。【原文：France’s long-term borrowing costs climbed to the highest level since 2011 amid concerns the country could be downgraded to single-A for the first time ever.】

item.title: 制裁后俄罗斯石油运输时间延长七倍
item.description: 向中国运送 200 万桶俄罗斯石油的时间比 1 月份美国对莫斯科实施一轮制裁之前延长了七倍。【原文：The delivery of a two-million-barrel cargo of Russian oil to China took seven times longer than it would have done prior to a round of US sanctions imposed on Moscow back in January.】

item.title: S&P 500 指数跌入调整仅用了 16 天
item.description: 市场数据截至美国东部时间上午 06:39。根据供应商协议，市场数据可能会有所延迟。【原文：Market data as of 06:39 am EST. Market data may be delayed depending on provider agreements.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长雷恩连任芬兰银行行长
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员奥利-雷恩（Olli Rehn）连任芬兰银行行长。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Olli Rehn won a second term as head of the Bank of Finland.】

item.title: 欧盟敦促各国推进资本市场发展
item.description: 欧盟官员正敦促成员国搁置长期以来在资本市场集中监管问题上的冲突，以便加快国防融资。【原文：European Union officials are urging member countries to set aside long-standing clashes over centralized supervision of capital markets so they can accelerate defense financing.】

item.title: 特朗普推动创纪录涨势，黄金突破 3000 美元
item.description: 黄金价格有史以来首次突破每盎司 3,000 美元，这主要是受央行疯狂购买、全球经济脆弱以及美国总统唐纳德-特朗普试图通过对盟友和战略对手征收关税来改写全球贸易规则的影响。【原文：Gold prices passed $3,000 an ounce for the first time ever, driven higher by a central bank buying spree, economic fragility worldwide, and President Donald Trump’s attempts to rewrite the rules of global trade by imposing tariffs on allies and strategic rivals.】

item.title: 中国宣布利用人工智能生成标签清除虚假信息
item.description: 中国与欧盟和美国一道推出了控制虚假信息的新法规，要求对网上合成内容进行标注。【原文：China joined the EU and US in rolling out new regulation to control disinformation by requiring labeling of synthetic content online.】

item.title: 据说《刺客信条》的创作者育碧正在寻找游戏支持者
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，育碧娱乐公司（Ubisoft Entertainment SA）正在寻求为一个新实体引入投资者，该实体将包括其一些核心视频游戏知识产权，其中包括《刺客信条》（Assassin's Creed）。【原文：Ubisoft Entertainment SA is looking to bring in investors to a new entity that will include some of its core video-gaming intellectual property, including Assassin’s Creed, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 中国威胁巴拿马协议，李嘉诚损失不大
item.description: 香港亿万富翁李嘉诚同意出售其对巴拿马港口的控制权以安抚美国总统唐纳德-特朗普，这引起了中国政府的愤怒。但中国政府可能不会因此对他进行惩罚。【原文：Hong Kong billionaire Li Ka-shing has raised Beijing’s ire by agreeing to sell its control over ports in Panama to appease President Donald Trump. But there may be little the Chinese authorities can do to punish him for it.】

item.title: 20 世纪初的一个市场指标为股市敲响警钟
item.description: 一个帮助预测美国股市走向的百年老指标发出信号，预示着饱受打击的投资者将面临更多痛苦。【原文：A century-old indicator that has helped predict the direction of the US stock market is signaling more pain ahead for battered investors.】

item.title: 起诉 1.65 亿美元的前德意志银行经理是施拉尔迪
item.description: 德意志银行前雇员达里奥-施拉尔迪（Dario Schiraldi）是德意志银行资产和财富管理部门的一名高级经理，他因一起刑事案件起诉这家德国贷款公司，索赔约 1.52 亿欧元（1.65 亿美元）。【原文：The former Deutsche Bank AG employee suing the German lender for around €152 million ($165 million) over a criminal case was a top manager from its asset and wealth management division, Dario Schiraldi.】

item.title: 马来西亚中央银行任命阿兹南-阿卜杜勒-阿齐兹为副行长
item.description: 马来西亚央行表示，阿兹南-阿卜杜勒-阿齐兹（Aznan Abdul Aziz）将出任副行长，任期三年，自 4 月 1 日起生效。【原文：Malaysia’s central bank said Aznan Abdul Aziz will become deputy governor for a three-year term effective April 1.】

item.title: 大众斯柯达为贸易战的二次伤害做好准备
item.description: 大众汽车公司（Volkswagen AG）旗下的斯柯达（Skoda）公司甚至没有在北美销售汽车，但仍受到美国、欧洲和中国之间不断升级的贸易战的影响。【原文：Volkswagen AG’s Skoda isn’t even selling cars in North America, yet still sees an impact from an escalating trade war between the US, Europe and China.】

item.title: 尽管债券销售强劲，中国信贷扩张仍令人失望
item.description: 尽管有强劲的国债销售作为支撑，但中国信贷扩张的速度低于一年前的预期。【原文：China’s credit expansion picked up less than expected from a year ago, despite support from strong government bond sales.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚局势动荡推迟预算修正令债券投资者惶恐不安
item.description: 罗马尼亚动荡的政局让投资者担心，为提振欧盟风险最高的政府债券所需的财政措施将面临进一步拖延。【原文：Romania’s turbulent politics is making investors wary that the fiscal steps needed to boost the European Union’s riskiest government bonds will face further delays.】

item.title: 曼联 20 亿英镑的体育场计划将债台高筑
item.description: 曼联集团本周出人意料地宣布了新建一座可容纳 100,000 人的体育场的计划。现在，它需要找到资金。【原文：Manchester United Plc’s surprise announcement this week of plans for a new 100,000-seater stadium was the easy bit. Now it needs to find the money.】

item.title: 赛捷首席执行官谈 "坏老板"：危机中最不需要的就是恐慌
item.description:
Steve Hare 谈论了全球动荡的影响，以及领导者如何在不确定的时期乘胜追击。【原文：

Steve Hare talks about the impact of global volatility and how leaders can multiply the good or the bad in uncertain times. 

】

item.title: 美国进出口银行批准为道达尔莫桑比克液化天然气项目提供 47 亿美元贷款
item.description: 据知情人士透露，美国进出口银行董事会批准了一笔 47 亿美元的贷款，这笔贷款是道达尔能源 SE 莫桑比克液化天然气项目的最大一笔融资。【原文：The US Export-Import Bank’s board approved a $4.7 billion loan that makes up the biggest piece of financing for TotalEnergies SE’s Mozambique LNG project, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】
